benchmark_details.name: RoboTwin 2.0: A Scalable Data Generator and Benchmark with Strong Domain Randomization for Robust Bimanual Robotic Manipulation
benchmark_details.overview: RoboTwin 2.0 is a scalable simulation-based data generation framework designed to produce high-quality, diverse, realistic, and interaction-rich datasets for bimanual manipulation, integrating an expert data generation pipeline with a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating policy generalization to cluttered environments and open-ended language goals.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support scalable research in robust bimanual manipulation by providing a diverse and realistic dataset along with standardized evaluation protocols.

data.source: RoboTwin-OD, a large-scale object library and automated data generation pipeline.
data.annotation: Annotated with semantic and manipulation-relevant labels.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the success rate of generated programs and efficiency of the data generation pipeline.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates better performance of the generated policies, with lower Token Count reflecting higher efficiency.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline results from RoboTwin 1.0 indicate significant improvements in ASR and efficiency.
methodology.validation: Through controlled experiments evaluating performance on benchmark tasks.
